title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 1388/94 of 17 June 1994 exempting certain Member States from the obligation to buy in certain fruit and vegetables
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1388/94 of 17 June 1994 exempting certain Member States from the obligation to buy in certain fruit and vegetables
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The following Member States are hereby exempted from the obligations to make intervention purchases, as provided for in Article 19a of Regulation (EEC) No 1035/72, of pears from 1 July to 31 August 1994, and peaches, apricots, tomatoes and  aubergines during the 1994/95 marketing year:
Belgium,
Denmark,
Germany,
Ireland,
Luxembourg,
Netherlands,
United Kingdom.
This exemption shall apply in respect of Greece only to the pears during the summer period referred to above.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
